channel.title: Having trouble getting my server available to the public
channel.description:
Yes, I am new to this whole server thing. Now, I've basically tried everything, that I know. The end result, people are still unable to connect to my server. Yes, I've port forwarded, and I set up a no-ip, so I don't think that's the problem:
[IMG]http://i178.photobucket.com/albums/w250/sand_ranger/Mesh2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i178.photobucket.com/albums/w250/sand_ranger/Mesh4.png[/img]
Right, here's my environmental variables, just in case:
[IMG]http://i178.photobucket.com/albums/w250/sand_ranger/Mesh5.png[/img] [IMG]http://i178.photobucket.com/albums/w250/sand_ranger/Mesh6.png[/img]
I have also set it up so the ip would route to no-ip, but I'm obviously missing something:
[IMG]http://i178.photobucket.com/albums/w250/sand_ranger/Meh3.png[/img]
I was told that was basically all I had to change, in order to get the no-ip to work. However, it didn't work and I'm at a loss and he's at a loss at what I'm supposed to do in order to get it to work. So, can someone please help me? On another note, this is an Exion client. It's also an Exion source. Hopefully that covers everything.

item.title: Having trouble getting my server available to the public
item.dc:creator: @range_mage range mage
item.description:
@range_mage wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:6, topic:415736”][quote author=range mage link=topic=517678.msg3760567#msg3760567 date=1316833184]

There is your problem. Try to disable your firewall.

Well, that didn’t work. I tried adding the port, as an exception and that didn’t work. Then I tried turning the firewall off, to see if that would help… Sadly, that didn’t do anything either. D:
[/quote]Do you have anti-virus with a firewall?[/quote]

Yes, I use an anti-virus with my firewall.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Well, that didn’t work. I tried adding the port, as an exception and that didn’t work. Then I tried turning the firewall off, to see if that would help… Sadly, that didn’t do anything either. D:[/quote]Do you have anti-virus with a firewall?

item.title: Having trouble getting my server available to the public
item.dc:creator: @range_mage range mage
item.description:
@range_mage wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:2, topic:415736”]Make sure you port forwaded and not port triggered. I had that problem before. I was port triggered and shit was so difficult, nobody knew what was causing it, nobody could help.
It might be your ‘java’ command, too. That’s another error I have.
Name out the path of your jdk instead of writing ‘java’.

Check at www.canyouseeme.org to see what it has to say.[/quote]

Error: I could not see your service on ***------- on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

What’s the difference between port forwarding and port triggering? I followed the guide, on port forwarding, at portfroward.com. So, I’m sure I did it right… At least, I think I did.

Read full topic
item.source: Having trouble getting my server available to the public

item.title: Having trouble getting my server available to the public
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Make sure you port forwaded and not port triggered. I had that problem before. I was port triggered and shit was so difficult, nobody knew what was causing it, nobody could help.
It might be your ‘java’ command, too. That’s another error I have.
Name out the path of your jdk instead of writing ‘java’.

Check at www.canyouseeme.org to see what it has to say.

Read full topic
